original_solution_mapping.L1: Paul has 10 hours of homework from weekdays because 2 x 5 = <<10=10>>10
original_solution_mapping.L3: He has 5 days to do his homework because 7 - 2 = <<7-2=5>>5
original_solution_mapping.L4: He needs to do 3 hours a night because 15 / 5 = <<15/5=3>>3

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 4668.
    Returns: the average hours of homework Paul needs to do per night.
    """
    # L1
    hours_per_weeknight = 2 # 2 hours of homework on weeknights
    weeknights_in_week = 5 # WK
    total_weeknight_homework = hours_per_weeknight * weeknights_in_week

    # L2
    weekend_homework = 5 # 5 hours for the entire weekend
    total_homework_hours = weekend_homework + total_weeknight_homework

    # L3
    days_in_week = 7 # WK
    practice_nights = 2 # practice 2 nights out of the week
    available_homework_nights = days_in_week - practice_nights

    # L4
    average_hours_per_night = total_homework_hours / available_homework_nights

    # FA
    answer = average_hours_per_night
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: Paul has {total_weeknight_homework} hours of homework from weekdays because {hours_per_weeknight} x {weeknights_in_week} = <<{total_weeknight_homework}={total_weeknight_homework}>>{total_weeknight_homework}
He has {available_homework_nights} days to do his homework because {days_in_week} - {practice_nights} = <<{days_in_week}-{practice_nights}={available_homework_nights}>>{available_homework_nights}

He needs to do {average_hours_per_night} hours a night because {total_homework_hours} / {available_homework_nights} = <<{total_homework_hours}/{available_homework_nights}={average_hours_per_night}>>{average_hours_per_night}

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L3: He has 5 days to do his homework because 7 - 2 = <<7-2=5>>5
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L4: He needs to do 1 hours a night because 5 / 5 = <<5/5=1>>1

explanation: Incorrect operand. The variable 'weekend_homework' (value: 5) was used instead of 'total_homework_hours' (value: 15).
